{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3085850,"name":"Johnny","username":"FRCStudent","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/e480ec/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-09-30T15:36:42.318Z","cooked":"

Hello Engineers!

Today a mentor and I were having a discussion about 2D Engineering Drawings. A few students were CADing a part that they had an engineering drawing for. The drawing is an assembly with separate pages with individual parts. Each individual part has only one sectional view on the page (the part is cut in half, but revolved). Given your expert opinion, what orientation (Top, Front, or Right side) would you say these parts are? Both of us had different answers and I would love to see what you all think.

Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2022-09-30T15:37:06.239Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":605,"reads":441,"readers_count":440,"score":3113.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":415648,"topic_slug":"engineering-drawings-question","display_username":"Johnny","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48124,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/engineering-drawings-question/415648/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3085856,"name":"Mike Taylor (he/him)","username":"Taylor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/taylor/{size}/232955_2.png","created_at":"2022-09-30T15:52:24.522Z","cooked":"

PLTW Teacher here, not an engineer.

I would say the convention of naming Top/Front/Right are so subjective and contextual that this would be an impossible question to answer.

The front view is traditionally the one that shows the overall contour of an object; where the important functional parts are; often the one that shows the longest dimensions. General rule of thumb is if somebody is asked to draw a 2D sketch of the item, the first inclination would be the “front” of it.

Where this gets tricky is if one is drawing, say, a school bus. 95% of folks asked to draw a school bus would probably draw the face showing the entry/exit door, the windows, the tires, etc. However, the actual front of the bus would be the headlight end, right?

To make orthographic projections on a landscape-oriented page, I would argue the “front” view of the bus would be the actual “side” of the bus, with the taillights on the left side and the headlights facing right. This would make the headlight end the “right” view, and the “top” view would be aligned with the long edge of the paper.

Similarly, round objects could be mounted in any orientation. For headlights, the circle is seen in the Y direction; for Andy Griffith-style police lights, the circle would be about the Z axis. But if I would make section views of them, they’d be oriented identically.

<.disclaimer> If a pile of engineers comes in and prove me wrong, that’s a lesson I’m happy to take. <./disclaimer>

Do you have a picture of said parts/drawings?

Generally speaking front vs right vs top views are rather subjective. As a general rule of thumb though, whatever view shows the most detail is typically my front view.

Edit: @Taylor gave a perfect answer above

Thank you both for your reply. I agree with both of you. It is a very weird drawing. We bought these shafts that build a gearbox assembly for an offseason project and this is the drawing that was downloaded for the shaft as they do not have any CAD models! Obviously this is a section view, so how would you guys CAD it? At this point, it is just for our curiosity how you guys would do it.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2022-09-30T16:21:38.725Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":332,"readers_count":331,"score":91.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":415648,"topic_slug":"engineering-drawings-question","display_username":"Johnny","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":3,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48124,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/engineering-drawings-question/415648/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3085861,"name":"Brian Wagg","username":"cad321","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/c57346/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-09-30T16:03:22.588Z","cooked":"

While the sectional view itself wouldn’t be the front view, that orientation would be the front view IMO. It very clearly shows the most details and features of the parts.

Sounds good! That is what I was telling everyone, but just wanted to hear from someone outside of our team because it is so subjective. Thanks!

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2022-09-30T16:22:27.967Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":303,"readers_count":302,"score":80.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":415648,"topic_slug":"engineering-drawings-question","display_username":"Johnny","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":19532,"username":"cad321","name":"Brian Wagg","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/c57346/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48124,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/engineering-drawings-question/415648/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3085903,"name":"JamesCH95","username":"JamesCH95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jamesch95/{size}/1200_2.png","created_at":"2022-09-30T17:13:31.895Z","cooked":"

Front/side/top/whatever view is completely immaterial when creating a drawing. The drafter/designer/engineer should seek to create a drawing that fully captures the part(s) feature(s) with as few views and dimensions as possible while being as easy to read as reasonable.

Taylor:

I would say the convention of naming Top/Front/Right are so subjective and contextual that this would be an impossible question to answer.

Essentially this.

I would add three other things:

  1. Making good drawings is hard and requires a lot of focus and practice, and I encounter many bad drawings in my work.
  2. Do not ever think that there is only one correct way to create a drawing or type of drawing.
  3. You may run into someone(s) who tell you that drawings must be done a certain way and they are not always right.

Story time: I have worked for (sadly) a couple individuals who told James Meadows, to his face, that he was creating a drawing and GD&T in correctly. Now you may be wondering ‘who the heck is James Meadows?’

Here he is!

Here he is again!

Yeah… they told the guy who literally wrote the book on much of the modern drawing and dimensioning practices that he was wrong. (It was a shame because he’s a super nice guy and gives his email to all of his students so you can ask him questions in the future, which I have done several times.)

Suffice it to say that they were wrong, Meadows was right, and the drawings we make at my work suck a whole lot less now after some… heated discussions.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2022-09-30T17:13:31.895Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":285,"readers_count":284,"score":277.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":415648,"topic_slug":"engineering-drawings-question","display_username":"JamesCH95","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":13}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":3782,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/engineering-drawings-question/415648/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":13},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":14,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3086128,"name":"Patrick","username":"Patrick3357","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-01T22:58:56.035Z","cooked":"

Yes, as I consulting/contract engineer, I have run into so many clients who have their way of arranging the dimensions, or standard views that only they use, and they get so indignant that theirs is the only right way.

Any drawing that contains all the necessary information for making and inspecting the part/assembly without being hard to read is a good drawing. Depending on the purpose of the drawing you might not even need to dimension all the features. It is common place in my industry to only show overall dimensions on sheet metal parts to be cut on a laser, and rely on the DXF or 3d model for actually cutting the part.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2022-10-01T22:58:56.035Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":231,"readers_count":230,"score":196.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":415648,"topic_slug":"engineering-drawings-question","display_username":"Patrick","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":3782,"username":"JamesCH95","name":"JamesCH95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jamesch95/{size}/1200_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52597,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Build mentor"},"post_url":"/t/engineering-drawings-question/415648/8","custom_user_title":"Build mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3086252,"name":"JamesCH95","username":"JamesCH95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jamesch95/{size}/1200_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-02T21:06:02.370Z","cooked":"

“Refer to 3D database” is my favorite note of all time.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2022-10-02T21:06:02.370Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":203,"readers_count":202,"score":155.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":415648,"topic_slug":"engineering-drawings-question","display_username":"JamesCH95","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52597,"username":"Patrick3357","name":"Patrick","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":3782,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/engineering-drawings-question/415648/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7},{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":11,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3086278,"name":"philso","username":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-10-02T23:24:20.938Z","cooked":"

Making good drawings that clearly communicate the necessary ideas and information and are easy to read is an art that not enough people are good at.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2022-10-02T23:24:20.938Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":191,"readers_count":190,"score":68.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":415648,"topic_slug":"engineering-drawings-question","display_username":"philso","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":3782,"username":"JamesCH95","name":"JamesCH95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jamesch95/{size}/1200_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15467,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/engineering-drawings-question/415648/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3086318,"name":"Alex Jurek","username":"Alex_Jurek","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/alex_jurek/{size}/227637_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-03T04:17:06.546Z","cooked":"

Spot on. I always have taught that the FRONT drawing should be the largest and most descriptive view of the object. Your bus analogy is perfect for understanding ‘front view’ for an orthographoc layout. I will be using this in my Mech Design classes here forth!

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2022-10-03T04:18:39.133Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":181,"readers_count":180,"score":76.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":415648,"topic_slug":"engineering-drawings-question","display_username":"Alex Jurek","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":5678,"username":"Taylor","name":"Mike Taylor (he/him)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/taylor/{size}/232955_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20952,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Jumpstart Initiative, CMNRH"},"post_url":"/t/engineering-drawings-question/415648/11","custom_user_title":"Jumpstart Initiative, CMNRH","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3086348,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-03T13:41:53.931Z","cooked":"
philso:

good drawings

I have no idea where I saw someone’s “rules for design projects” but the gist of one rule is learn to draw because the best drawings are the ones that advance to prototypes. The first Saturday of the year and I suggest to students to take an extra minute to make a better sketch.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2022-10-03T13:41:53.931Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":163,"readers_count":162,"score":37.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":415648,"topic_slug":"engineering-drawings-question","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/engineering-drawings-question/415648/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3086374,"name":"Richard Wallace","username":"Richard_Wallace","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/richard_wallace/{size}/110760_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-03T15:17:26.650Z","cooked":"

A good drawing really is worth at least a thousand words. Several thousand more likely, for a complex drawing that communicates requirements clearly.

A bad drawing can actually be worthless, or even have negative value, because it needs thousands of words to unravel.

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2022-10-03T15:34:08.904Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":141,"readers_count":140,"score":38.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":415648,"topic_slug":"engineering-drawings-question","display_username":"yadin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49515,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5987 Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/engineering-drawings-question/415648/14","custom_user_title":"5987 Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3086417,"name":"techhelpbb","username":"techhelpbb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/techhelpbb/{size}/5032_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-03T18:25:41.768Z","cooked":"

I have always been curious how infrequently, since my high school drafting class using blue printing, I’ve heard people use the terms isometric and orthographic. Search the terms on ChiefDelphi for example.

en.m.wikipedia.org

Isometric projection

Isometric projection is a method for visually representing three-dimensional objects in two dimensions in technical and engineering drawings. It is an axonometric projection in which the three coordinate axes appear equally foreshortened and the angle between any two of them is 120 degrees. The term "isometric" comes from the Greek for "equal measure", reflecting that the scale along each axis of the projection is the same (unlike some other forms of graphical projection). An isometric view of...

I agree with the others:

A good drawing or drawing set for something exposes adequate details to understand that thing. Exposes, as well, any details lost if as a matter of perspective or requirements it can not be illustrated.

If you present me a drawing set for a school bus it should be notable to me that said surface is the outside of an object that has cavities and other elements within it. That may seem obvious with a school bus, but it really does matter you communicate consistently and fully resolve important details in this process.

To extend this: if I give you drawings of 3D object to be printed on an FDM printer with a specific infill pattern in a specific orientation to the outer more solid surface (like a gear), it quickly becomes obvious why that detail should be acknowledged.

I don’t see the actual item being described, so I’ll leave my comment at this point.

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2022-10-03T18:27:53.969Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":134,"readers_count":133,"score":81.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":415648,"topic_slug":"engineering-drawings-question","display_username":"techhelpbb","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Isometric_projection","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Isometric projection - Wikipedia","clicks":2}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14778,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/engineering-drawings-question/415648/16","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3086424,"name":"John Hascall (he)","username":"john3928","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-03T19:25:55.119Z","cooked":"
Patrick3357:

I have run into so many clients who have their way of arranging the dimensions, or standard views that only they use, and they get so indignant that theirs is the only right way.

There is not only one way to do it, but there is value in an organization picking one way and consistently using that way.

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2022-10-03T19:25:55.119Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":114,"readers_count":113,"score":32.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":415648,"topic_slug":"engineering-drawings-question","display_username":"John Hascall (he)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46267,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Opinions expressed are mine only"},"post_url":"/t/engineering-drawings-question/415648/17","custom_user_title":"Opinions expressed are mine only","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3086427,"name":"Patrick","username":"Patrick3357","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-03T19:48:51.120Z","cooked":"

Agreed.
My particular problem as a consulting engineer, is the companies that don’t give precise, thorough drawing standards, then complain that our drawings aren’t “right”. For reference I usually work with any given client on a single project for a few weeks or maybe months at the most.

For anyone out there looking to hire outside engineers for your projects, prepare detailed drawing standards or plan on altering the drawings in-house if you want more than any valid drawing containing necessary information. In my experience your going to spend a lot more time and money on emails trying to decipher your unwritten drawing standard than you would do your own corrections. (This would be different if the project contains many rounds of drawings over the course of a large project)

Patrick3357:

For anyone out there, … prepare detailed drawing standards …

[FTFY]

Any competent organization should do this – what does it say about your business that teams of high-schoolers are doing better at this than you?
